summary: Elizabeth C Feeley was an employee of the U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). She is mentioned in several payroll and certification reports spanning from December 1977 to March 1979. These documents list her name, position, salary, and earnings during different accounting periods. The consistent appearance of her name across multiple payroll certifications and reports indicates her sustained employment with the HSCA during its investigation.
significance: Elizabeth C Feeley's significance lies in her role as an employee of the HSCA, contributing to the administrative and operational functions of the committee during its investigation into the JFK assassination. While the documents do not specify her exact role, her inclusion in payroll records confirms her involvement in the committee's activities.
